River Queen attempts to pack a complicated, sweeping, historical narrative into just under two hours. There are some breathtaking battle scenes and the Wanganui scenery is beautiful, well suited to this hybrid of science fiction/drama set in the middle ages / Elizabethan era. This film would make an excellent History Channel special, but is no substitute for a good read on this subject.

After watching this movie, I couldn't help but notice the parallels between it and another film called America 3000. Both were very bad mid 1980's scifi movies that feature a girl who fantasizes about robots (like Wall-e) making her life better. In both cases she risks everything to escape into a Utopia like one ruled by robots.
The only difference was that in America 3000, her boyfriend comes to rescue her with some friends.

I was too tired, but John was there with me as well. Bluray will make things look SO much better! It might still end up looking weird for the extended version though, although kind of hard to tell since it's supposed to be weir

While credited as a Tom and Jerry cartoon, this is not the cat-and-mouse team but an earlier Mutt-and-Jeff rip-off featuring them going about to survive in today's turbulent economy. In the end, Jerry MEA Culpa falls off a building trying to prove his super-sized ego. Same old Tom chasing Jerry story but funny along the way.
The wild times shared by two old codgers who should have stayed far away from each other instead of ending up

Snow White is in my opinion a bad movie on an artistic point of view. The plot is pretty much foreseeable, the characters are stereotypes, the editing too. But it’s got vibes that pulls you in and reminds me of your favorite horror movies. The biggest thing to keep you watching : Fleabag ‘s Phoebe Waller-Bridges ‘ seamless acting ! I discovered her looking for a fantasy series found “The End of the F@*king World”

What is left of Planet Earth is populated by a few poor and starving rag-tag survivors. They must eat bugs and insects, or whatever they can find. The wealthy fliers have found safe haven in the space colonies with enough food to sustain them.
But the menace from space returns as they return disharmonious tactics that escalate the battle into infighting among mankind itself. Now it's a case of "do you take potato soup or protein

Michael Dudikoff stars as Joe Armstrong a martial artist who fights ninjas who are stealing weapons from the U.S Army, in this entertaining yet admittedly brainless comedic action film. This film is clearly an attempt to create a cult phenomenon like the John Woo Bruce Lee martial arts films of the Sixties and Seventies. Unfortunately, its counterpart today would be something like "Menace II Society" or any of those slam-bang Hollyweird horror flicks of recent years
